title: Raquel Anderson
text:
Raquel Anderson (born 2 November 1991) is a New Zealand <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played for the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> in the <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a>. A or , she is a <a href="Kiwi%20Ferns">New Zealand</a> representative. 
Playing career.
A Manurewa Marlins junior, Anderson made her debut for <a href="New%20Zealand%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in their <a href="2017%20Women%27s%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup">2017 Women's Rugby League World Cup</a> warm-up match against the Maori Wahine Toa. In November 2017, she represented New Zealand at the World Cup, playing two games.
In 2018, she joined the <a href="New%20Zealand%20Warriors">New Zealand Warriors</a> <a href="NRL%20Women%27s%20Premiership">NRL Women's Premiership</a> team. In Round 2 of the <a href="2018%20NRL%20Women%27s%20season">2018 NRL Women's premiership</a>, she made her debut for the Warriors, scoring a try in a 10–22 loss to the <a href="St%20George%20Illawarra%20Dragons">St George Illawarra Dragons</a>.
On 22 June 2019, she came off the bench in New Zealand's 46–8 win over <a href="Samoa%20women%27s%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Samoa</a> at <a href="Mt%20Smart%20Stadium">Mt Smart Stadium</a>.
